intro: Agalmyla villosa, commonly known as the hairy agalmyla, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, hairy foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Agalmyla villosa typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and horticultural cultivation.
